page.title: 02Sparkwell Village
page.content: There are about 110 houses in Sparkwell, nearly half of them are terraced. There are about 34 bungalows. Most of the walls are made of brick and most of the roofs are made of slate. There are 19 street lights in Sparkwell. We have one shop which is owned by Mr. and Mrs.Weatherby. The Post Office is in a room in Mrs.Smith's house. We have a new Community Hall and a men's club that is run by Mr Small. We have one pub called "The Treby Arms" that is owned by Mr. and Mrs.Dryden. We have two bus stops, a telephone box and a postbox. We have one playing field. Our church is called All Saints, Sparkwell. Our school that has 22 children. Since 1976 the Headmaster has been Mr. Soloman.
